meanings.definition: A constituent part or element of a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: The puzzle pieces are like partons that come together to form the complete picture.
meanings.sent2: The ingredients in the recipe act as partons to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent3: The team of superheroes each had their unique partons that combined to defeat the villain.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the trees, animals, and plants are all partons of the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The different colors of paint are the partons that blend to make a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A person who takes part in something.
meanings.sent1: The volunteers at the event were enthusiastic partons who helped make it a success.
meanings.sent2: She was a dedicated partons of the charity organization, always ready to lend a hand.
meanings.sent3: The little girl eagerly raised her hand to be a partons in the school play.
meanings.sent4: As a partons of the debate team, he always had insightful arguments to contribute.
meanings.sent5: The audience members were active partons in the interactive performance.

meanings.sent1: She carefully partons the cake into equal slices for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will partons the engine to identify the source of the problem.
meanings.sent3: The magician seemed to partons the rabbit into multiple pieces before putting it back together.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked the students to partons the sentence into subject and predicate.
meanings.sent5: He decided to partons his time between work and hobbies for a better balance.
